intro: Goniophlebium dissimile, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a species of vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with narrow, grass-like leaves arranged in whorls around its stem. It produces spore-bearing cones, which are clustered at the tips of its branches. Goniophlebium dissimile is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in maintaining soil stability in its native habitat.
